18 from datetime import datetime
19 import json
20 import os
21 from pathlib import Path
22 import rospy
23 import subprocess
24 
25 from niryo_robot_rpi.msg import StorageStatus, LogStatus
26 from niryo_robot_msgs.srv import SetInt
27 
28 from niryo_robot_database.srv import GetSettings, SetSettings
29 
30 #
31 # This class will handle storage on Raspberry Pi
32 #
33 
34 
35 class StorageManager:
36 
37  def __init__(self):
38  rospy.logdebug("StorageManager - Entering in Init")
39 
40  process_result = subprocess.run(['roslaunch-logs'], capture_output=True, encoding='utf-8', check=True)
41  current_ros_logs_path = Path(process_result.stdout.strip())
42  self.__log_path = current_ros_logs_path.parent
43  self.__run_id = current_ros_logs_path.stem
44 
45  get_setting_service = rospy.ServiceProxy('/niryo_robot_database/settings/get', GetSettings)
46  get_setting_response = get_setting_service('purge_ros_logs_on_startup')
47  self.__purge_log_on_startup = get_setting_response.value == 'True'
48 
49  self.__run_ids_file = self.__log_path.joinpath('run_ids.json')
50 
51  # clean log on startup if param is true
52  if self.__purge_log_on_startup:
53  rospy.logwarn("Purging ROS log on startup !")
54  self.purge_log()
55 
56  self.__update_run_ids_file()
57 
58  self.purge_log_server = rospy.Service('/niryo_robot_rpi/purge_ros_logs', SetInt, self.callback_purge_log)
59 
60  self.change_purge_log_on_startup_server = rospy.Service('/niryo_robot_rpi/set_purge_ros_log_on_startup',
61  SetInt,
62  self.callback_change_purge_log_on_startup)
63 
64  self.storage_status_publisher = rospy.Publisher('/niryo_robot_rpi/storage_status', StorageStatus, queue_size=10)
65 
66  # NS1 only
67  self.log_status_publisher = rospy.Publisher('/niryo_robot_rpi/ros_log_status', LogStatus, queue_size=10)
68 
69  self.timer = rospy.Timer(rospy.Duration(3), self.publish_storage_status)
70 
71  rospy.loginfo("Init Storage Manager OK")
72 
73  def __update_run_ids_file(self):
74  try:
75  run_ids = json.loads(self.__run_ids_file.read_text())
76  except (OSError, json.JSONDecodeError):
77  run_ids = {}
78  run_ids[datetime.now().isoformat()] = self.__run_id
79  self.__run_ids_file.write_text(json.dumps(run_ids, indent=2))
80 
81  def __clear_run_ids_file(self):
82  self.__run_ids_file.write_text('{}')
83 
84  @staticmethod
85  def get_storage(value):
86  try:
87  process = subprocess.Popen(['df', f'--output={value}', '/'], stdout=subprocess.PIPE)
88  output, error = process.communicate()
89  lines = output.decode().split(os.linesep)
90  if len(lines) >= 2:
91  return int(int(lines[1]) / 1024)
92  return -1
93  except subprocess.CalledProcessError:
94  return -1
95 
96  def get_available_disk_size(self):
97  return self.get_storage('avail')
98 
99  def get_total_disk_size(self):
100  return self.get_storage('size')
101 
102  def get_log_size(self):
103  try:
104  if not self.__log_path.is_dir():
105  return -1
106  process_result = subprocess.run(['du', '-sBM', str(self.__log_path)], capture_output=True, encoding='utf-8')
107  output_array = process_result.stdout.split()
108  if len(output_array) >= 1:
109  return int(output_array[0].replace('M', ''))
110  return -1
111  except subprocess.CalledProcessError:
112  return -1
113 
114  def purge_log(self):
115  try:
116  subprocess.call(['rosclean', 'purge', '--size', '50', '-y'])
117  self.__clear_run_ids_file()
118  rospy.loginfo("ROS Log Manager - Purging done")
119  return True
120  except subprocess.CalledProcessError as e:
121  rospy.logwarn(e)
122  return False
123 
124  #
125  # ----- ROS Interface below -----
126  #
127 
128  @staticmethod
129  def create_response(status, message):
130  return {'status': status, 'message': message}
131 
132  def callback_purge_log(self, _):
133  rospy.logwarn("Purge ROS logs on user request")
134  if self.purge_log():
135  return self.create_response(
136  200,
137  "ROS logs have been purged. " + "Following logs will be discarded. If you want to get logs, you " +
138  "need to restart the robot")
139  return self.create_response(400, "Unable to remove ROS logs")
140 
141  def callback_change_purge_log_on_startup(self, req):
142  set_setting_service = rospy.ServiceProxy('/niryo_robot_database/settings/set', SetSettings)
143  set_setting_service(name='purge_ros_logs', value=str(req.value == 1), type='bool')
144  return self.create_response(200, "Purge log on startup value has been changed")
145 
146  def publish_storage_status(self, _):
147  msg = StorageStatus()
148  msg.header.stamp = rospy.Time.now()
149  msg.log_size = self.get_log_size()
150  msg.available_disk_size = self.get_available_disk_size()
151  msg.total_disk_size = self.get_total_disk_size()
152  msg.purge_log_on_startup = self.__purge_log_on_startup
153  self.storage_status_publisher.publish(msg)
154 
155  # NS1 only
156  msg = LogStatus()
157  msg.header.stamp = rospy.Time.now()
158  msg.log_size = self.get_log_size()
159  msg.available_disk_size = self.get_available_disk_size()
160  msg.purge_log_on_startup = self.__purge_log_on_startup
161  self.log_status_publisher.publish(msg)
